definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: There's 'Nothing tastes as good as skinny feels.' That's one of them.
sentences.chinese: 比如‘没什么比骨感的滋味更好’就是其中之一。

sentences.english: I have a few very small way for you to be skinny twig.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个很好的小方法让你成为骨感美女。

sentences.english: The ideal is fullness, the reality is very skinny.
sentences.chinese: 理想很丰满，现实却很骨感。

sentences.english: Despite being very skinny, Han insists he needs to lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 已经十分“骨感”的韩火火仍坚持要减肥。

sentences.english: The ideal is always full, while the reality is always so skinny.
sentences.chinese: 理想永远都很丰满，而现实却一直那么骨感。

sentences.english: I will look more sophisticated and exquisite.
sentences.chinese: 我的脸看起来会更有骨感，更加精致。

sentences.english: Maybe dream too plump, reality is always too bone.
sentences.chinese: 也许梦想太丰满，现实总是太骨感。

definition: Fengman district of Jilin city 吉林市, Jilin province
(of a woman) to have nice curves/buxom/shapely
slender waist/fig. pretty woman/mortise and tenon joint on a coffin
thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
